champ.champInfo:
The general management of the organization and conduct of competitions is carried out by the organizational committee of the NGO "Federation of Kuodokyokushin Karate of Ukraine".
The direct responsibility for holding the competition rests with the NGO "Federation of Kuodokyokushin Karate of Ukraine" in the city of Poltava and the panel of judges. appointed and approved by the organizing committee of the competition.
The chief judge of the competition was approved by the head of the NGO "FKKU", sports judge sensei D.M. Boklaschuk, 4 dan (Poltava city).
Sempaya Barabash R.O., 2 dan (Poltava) was appointed and approved as the coordinator of the competition on organizational issues.
Sempaya Ivanova O.V., 2 dan (Poltava) was appointed and approved as the technical secretary of the competition.

The competition will be held in Poltava on October 15, 2023.
Venue: Poltava, st. INDEPENDENCE SQUARE, 24A, "POLTAVA" DYSSH.
Date of arrival: October 15, 2023
Start of the competition on October 15, 2023 at 10:00
Day of departure: October 15, 2023, 2023

Competition organizing committee:

Dmytro Mykhailovych Boklaschuk

tel.: (067) 531-80-51

Preliminary applications for participation in the competition must be sent by October 6, 2023 (inclusive) to the address: e-mail: Tatarchenkoiu@ukr.net
Phone numbers regarding previous applications: Ihor Tatarchenko - 067 788 77 28;

Program

October 15, 2023

  • 09:00-09:40 mandate and medical commission
  • 10:00-10:15 official opening of the competition
  • 10:15-13:00 start of competitions in the "Kumite" section in categories 4-9 years, awarding of winners in these categories
  • 13:00-16:00 start of competitions in the "Kumite" section in categories 10-15 years old, awarding of winners in these categories

Competition participants

Athletes from kyokushinkai karate, kyokushin karate (IBU kyodokyokushin) of Ukraine take part in the competition, other international teams may be admitted subject to an official invitation by the organizing committee

Tournament rules

Competitions (individual) are held according to the Olympic system in accordance with the regulations of the NGO "FKKU" on judging requirements for kyokushin karate.

Categories KUMITE young men

  • _U5 (0-9kyu, 8kyu and above): -20, 20+
  • _U7 (0-9kyu, 8kyu and higher): -20, -25, -30, -35, +35
  • _U9 (0-9kyu, 8kyu and higher): -25, -30, -35, -40, -45, +45
  • U11 (0-9kyu, 8kyu and higher): -30, -35, -40, -45, -50, +50
  • U13 (0-9kyu, 8kyu and above): -40, -45, -50, -55, -60, +60
  • U15 (0-9kyu, 8kyu and above): -50, -55, -60, +60

Categories KUMITE girls

  • _U7 (0-9kyu, 8kyu and higher): -25, -30, -35, -40, +40
  • _U9 (0-9kyu, 8kyu and higher): -25, -30, -35, -40, +40
  • U11 (0-9kyu, 8kyu and higher): -30, -35, -40, -45, +45
  • U13 (0-9kyu, 8kyu and above): -35, -40, -45, -50, +50
  • U15 (0-9kyu, 8kyu and above): -50, -55, -60, +60

Conducting matches and duration of matches.

  • _U5: 1.0 min, 1.0 min, weigh-in, 1.0 min (difference in weight for victory - 2 kg)
  • _U7: 1.0 min, 1.0 min, weigh-in, 1.0 min (difference in weight for victory - 2 kg)
  • _U9: 1.5 min, 1.5 min, weigh-in, 1.0 min (difference in weight for victory - 2 kg)
  • U11: 1.5 min, 1.5 min, weigh-in, 1.0 min (difference in weight for victory - 2 kg)
  • U13: 1.5 min, 1.5 min, weigh-in, 1.0 min (difference in weight for victory - 3 kg)
  • U15: 2.0 min, 2.0 min, weigh-in, 1.0 min (difference in weight for victory - 3 kg)

If the number of athletes is insufficient, the competition organizers may combine some weight categories.

The fee for participation in the competition is UAH 700.

Rewarding

  • Athletes who took 1-3 places are awarded diplomas of relevant degrees, medals and cups
